thread.title: News from around Wisconsin at 5:28 a.m. CDT
thread.title_full: News from around Wisconsin at 5:28 a.m. CDT

title: News from around Wisconsin at 5:28 a.m. CDT
text:
News from around Wisconsin at 5:28 a.m. CDT Sunday, October 25, 2015 By - Associated Press - Sunday, October 25, 2015 Badgers’ Stave out of Illinois game with head injury 
CHAMPAIGN, Ill. (AP) - Wisconsin quarterback Joel Stave has been ruled out against Illinois with an unspecified head injury. 
Stave left the game late in the first quarter and did not return. He was sacked early by Illinois defensive end Carroll Phillips and left the field but briefly returned. Stave was 3 of 7 for 49 yards. 
Stave was replaced by Bart Houston. 
___ Wisconsin GOP abolishes John Doe probes, seeks other changes 
MADISON, Wis. (AP) - Wisconsin Republicans are moving at breakneck speed to abolish secret investigations into political corruption, do away with the state’s unique nonpartisan elections board and loosen campaign finance rules. 
The moves come after Republicans were angered by a secret investigation of Gov. Scott Walker that was approved by the elections board and focused on coordination with conservative issue advocacy groups. 
Republicans deny they’re seeking retribution for the probe, which the state Supreme Court in July ended as unconstitutional. But Democrats and independent observers say the changes will transform the state’s elections and regulatory process, making it more difficult to investigate politicians for wrongdoing in office. 
Walker on Friday signed a measure eliminating the so-called John Doe investigations and he is generally supportive of the other two proposals. 
___ Flags lowered for Wisconsin airman killed in Afghanistan 
MILWAUKEE (AP) - Flags are flying at half-staff across the state for a Wisconsin airman killed in Afghanistan. 
Twenty-one-year-old Airman Quinn Johnson-Harris was a 2012 graduate of Homestead High School in the Milwaukee suburb of Mequon. Johnson-Harris was among 11 people killed Oct. 2 when an Air Force C-130 crashed at a base in Afghanistan. 
His memorial service is set for Saturday at Christian Faith Fellowship in Milwaukee. Gov. Scott Walker ordered flags lowered to half-staff for the day to honor Johnson-Harris “for his service anmd dedication to his country.”
